content:
Adam Neumann was no longer CEO or in control of WeWork by the time of the 2021 BowX SPAC merger. His ongoing exposure was primarily **economic**, not managerial: he retained a **minority equity stake** in WeWork and had **contractual/financial arrangements** stemming from his 2019 exit (including payments/settlements tied to his departure). He was **not expected to have an ongoing operational role** post-merger.

- **Confidence:** MEDIUM  
- **Source tag:** [TRAINING]  
- **Case note:** Specific to the WeWork/BowX context (relationship post-2019 exit and around the 2021 transaction), described at a high level.
